definition: lit. the night-blooming cactus shows once/flash in the pan (idiom)/short-lived
dark clouds
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to appear/present/now/existing/current

sentences.english: After the dazzling fireworks flower briefly as the broad-leaved epiphyllum, after the passion of vanity.
sentences.chinese: 煙火璀璨過後的曇花一現，激情過後的空虛失落。

sentences.english: The low inflation rate will be no flash in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 低通貨膨脹率不會只是曇花一現。

sentences.english: The trendy rock group was only a flash - in - the - pan.
sentences.chinese: 新潮搖滾樂隊只是曇花一現。

sentences.english: But as I said this morning, this can’t be a fleeting moment.
sentences.chinese: 但正如我今天上午所說，這不應當是曇花一現的瞬間。

sentences.english: It has become the symbol for all that is transient and evanescent in life.
sentences.chinese: 它已成爲所有的符號是短暫的曇花一現的生活。

sentences.english: We're hoping that this is a long-term opportunity, and not just a flash in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望這是一個長遠的機會，而不會只是曇花一現。

sentences.english: The upturn following a decline is often shortlived and prices might resume their decline.
sentences.chinese: 復甦後下降往往是曇花一現，價格可能恢復下降。

sentences.english: But emerging markets are prone to boom-and-bust cycles.
sentences.chinese: 但新興市場很容易陷入曇花一現的輪迴。

sentences.english: They are merely passers-by on the stage of history.
sentences.chinese: 他們不過是歷史舞臺上曇花一現的人物。

sentences.english: Cool, Lake painting wound, the fact bleak, flower briefly as the broad-leaved epiphyllum.
sentences.chinese: 微涼了，湖畔畫傷，望斷事實淒涼，曇花一現。

sentences.english: Who says this Fall's fabulous hairstyles can't last for multiple seasons?
sentences.chinese: 誰說這個秋季的超美髮型只是曇花一現？

sentences.english: Are we passers-by in the life of each other?Is our love bound to be a flash-in-the-pan?
sentences.chinese: 難道你我真的是生命中的過客，在生命中曇花一現嗎？

sentences.english: Without theoretical support the modernization of TCM could only be like a flower as the broad leaved Epiphyllum briefly.
sentences.chinese: 沒有中醫理論的支持，中醫藥現代化只能是曇花一現。

definition: to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to work to no avail (idiom)
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
to turn a blind eye to
to assert/assertion
to boast
to hit the big time
to count/reckoning
could happen at any moment/on the verge
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
changeable situation (idiom)
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: to retreat/to shrink back
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to foresee/to predict/to forecast/to envision/foresight/intuition/vision
